Plot Variable Importances

Plot Variable Importances

h2o.varimp_plot(model, num_of_features = NULL)

Arguments

model

A trained model (accepts a trained random forest, GBM, or deep learning model, will use h2o.std_coef_plot for a trained GLM
num_of_features

The number of features shown in the plot (default is 10 or all if less than 10).

See also

h2o.std_coef_plot for GLM.

Examples

library(h2o)
h2o.init()
#> Reading in config file: ./../../../../.h2oconfig
#> 
#> H2O is not running yet, starting it now...
#> Warning: cannot open file '/Users/terrytangyuan/h2o-3/h2o-r/h2o/branch.txt': No such file or directory
#> Error in file(con, "r"): cannot open the connection
prosPath <- system.file("extdata", "prostate.csv", package="h2o")
hex <- h2o.importFile(prosPath)
#> Error in h2o.getConnection(): No active connection to an H2O cluster. Did you run `h2o.init()` ?
hex[,2] <- as.factor(hex[,2])
#> Error in is.H2OFrame(x): object 'hex' not found
model <- h2o.gbm(x = 3:9, y = 2, training_frame = hex, distribution = "bernoulli")
#> Error in is.H2OFrame(training_frame): object 'hex' not found
h2o.varimp_plot(model)
#> Error in h2o.varimp_plot(model): object 'model' not found

# for deep learning set the variable_importance parameter to TRUE
iris.hex <- as.h2o(iris)
#> Error in h2o.getConnection(): No active connection to an H2O cluster. Did you run `h2o.init()` ?
iris.dl <- h2o.deeplearning(x = 1:4, y = 5, training_frame = iris.hex,
variable_importances = TRUE)
#> Error in is.H2OFrame(training_frame): object 'iris.hex' not found
h2o.varimp_plot(iris.dl)
#> Error in h2o.varimp_plot(iris.dl): object 'iris.dl' not found
